titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The post brought another newspaper–cutting – this time from Sheffield – appointing me to H___d [sic] !!!
writes in a tone of alarm. I reminded him that, as the Italians say, "
He that enters the Conclave a Pope, leaves it a Cardinal
In the afternoon a letter from

confirmed this view. He speaks as if the whole idea of sending me to the Bench had been definitely abandoned. This I interpret as meaning that the matter of the appointment has been decided, & that he has heard what the decision is, though he does not feel free to tell me what it is.
I attended a meeting of the House Committee at Sherburn Hospital.
